It is characterized by its distinctive, pale yellow to orange-green thallus, which is typically crustose in growth form. This lichen is often found on rock surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in low-nutrient conditions. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role as a pioneer species. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
